metadata.subject: chemistry
metadata.dotPoint: Simple and fractional distillation for separating and purifying organic compounds

distillation_principle.name: Distillation Principle
distillation_principle.correct: Distillation separates liquid mixtures based on differences in boiling points. The liquid with the lower boiling point vaporises first and is collected after condensation.

separates by density.error: That's decanting or using a separating funnel.
separates by density.fix: Distillation uses boiling point differences, not density.
separates by density.action: Density separation doesn't involve heating or phase changes.

separates by colour.fix: Boiling point determines what distils first.
separates by colour.action: Colourless liquids are easily separated by distillation.

separates by solubility.fix: Distillation relies on volatility (boiling point), not solubility.
separates by solubility.action: Both miscible and immiscible liquids can be distilled.

persistent.action: Make a table: filtration (particle size), distillation (boiling point), extraction (solubility).

simple_distillation_use.name: Simple Distillation Applications
simple_distillation_use.correct: Simple distillation is effective when boiling points differ by more than 25Â°C, or for separating a liquid from dissolved non-volatile solids (like salt from seawater).

works for all mixtures.error: Simple distillation fails for close boiling points.
works for all mixtures.fix: Need >25Â°C bp difference for good separation.
works for all mixtures.action: Close bp mixtures need fractional distillation.

only for pure liquids.fix: Pure liquids don't need separation. Mixtures do.
only for pure liquids.action: The point is to separate components of a mixture.

removes all impurities.fix: Dissolved solids with low volatility stay behind. Volatile impurities may co-distil.
removes all impurities.action: Consider what else might vaporise at similar temperatures.

persistent.gap: You don't understand when to use simple distillation.
persistent.action: Simple distillation: liquid from solid, OR bp difference >25Â°C.

fractional_distillation_use.name: Fractional Distillation Applications
fractional_distillation_use.correct: Fractional distillation is used when liquids have boiling points within 25Â°C of each other. The fractionating column provides multiple vaporisation-condensation cycles for better separation.

same as simple distillation.error: Fractional has a column; simple doesn't.
same as simple distillation.fix: The fractionating column enables multiple separations.
same as simple distillation.action: The column is the key difference.

only for petroleum.fix: Petroleum is one application, but any close-bp mixture can be fractionally distilled.

slower is worse.action: Take time = better separation in fractional distillation.

persistent.gap: You don't understand when to use fractional distillation.
persistent.action: Fractional: when bp difference <25Â°C. The column provides extra separation.

fractionating_column.name: Fractionating Column Function
fractionating_column.correct: The fractionating column contains surfaces where vapour condenses and re-vaporises multiple times. Each cycle enriches the vapour in the lower-boiling component.

just slows down the vapour.error: It enables repeated separation, not just slowing.
just slows down the vapour.action: Think of each cycle as another distillation step.

cools the vapour completely.error: The condenser does that, not the column.
cools the vapour completely.fix: Column has a temperature gradientâ€”hot at bottom, cooler at top.
cools the vapour completely.action: The column partially condenses, then re-vaporises.

filters out impurities.fix: Separation is by boiling point, achieved through repeated vaporisation.
filters out impurities.action: The column doesn't trap particles; it enables phase changes.

persistent.gap: You don't understand how the fractionating column works.
persistent.action: Visualise: vapour rises, partially condenses, lower-bp component re-vaporises and rises further.

condenser_function.name: Condenser Function
condenser_function.correct: The condenser cools the vapour to convert it back to liquid (the distillate). Cold water flows through the outer jacket while vapour passes through the inner tube.

heats the vapour.fix: The flask heats; the condenser cools.
heats the vapour.action: Condense = turn gas to liquid, which requires cooling.

water flows in the same direction as vap.fix: Water enters at the bottom (coolest where liquid exits).
water flows in the same direction as vap.action: Counter-current: water flows opposite to vapour for efficient cooling.

vapour flows through outer jacket.error: Vapour flows through inner tube; water through outer jacket.
vapour flows through outer jacket.fix: This keeps the vapour contained while surrounded by coolant.
vapour flows through outer jacket.action: Inner tube for vapour, outer jacket for cooling water.

persistent.action: Diagram: inner tube (vapour), outer jacket (cold water), counter-current flow.

boiling_point_relationship.name: Boiling Point and Volatility
boiling_point_relationship.formula: Lower bp = more volatile = distils first
boiling_point_relationship.correct: The component with the lower boiling point is more volatile and vaporises first. It reaches the condenser first and is collected as the first fraction.

higher bp distils first.error: Lower bp = vaporises more easily = distils first.
higher bp distils first.fix: Lower boiling point means less energy needed to vaporise.

all components distil together.error: They distil in order of boiling point.
all components distil together.fix: Lower bp components come over first, then higher bp.
all components distil together.action: Monitor temperature: it rises as you collect different fractions.

density determines distillation order.error: Boiling point, not density, determines order.
density determines distillation order.fix: Volatility (related to bp) determines what vaporises first.
density determines distillation order.action: Dense liquids can have low bp and distil first.

persistent.gap: You're confusing boiling point with other properties.
persistent.action: Order of distillation = order of boiling points (lowest first).

collecting_fractions.name: Collecting Fractions
collecting_fractions.correct: Different fractions are collected by changing the receiving vessel when the temperature changes significantly. Each fraction contains compounds within a specific boiling point range.

collect everything in one container.error: This defeats the purpose of separation.
collect everything in one container.fix: Change containers to collect different bp fractions separately.
collect everything in one container.action: Watch the thermometer and switch containers at temperature jumps.

temperature stays constant throughout.error: Temperature rises as higher-bp components distil.
temperature stays constant throughout.fix: Temperature increases in steps as each component distils.
temperature stays constant throughout.action: Plateaus indicate a single component; rises indicate transitions.

first fraction is always pure.error: First fraction may contain mixed components.
first fraction is always pure.fix: Some overlap occurs; middle of each fraction is purest.
first fraction is always pure.action: Discard the 'heads' and 'tails' for highest purity.

persistent.action: Monitor temperature, change receiver when temp rises, label each fraction by bp range.

distillate_purity.name: Distillate Purity
distillate_purity.correct: The purity of a distillate can be assessed by its boiling point range. A narrow range indicates higher purity; a broad range indicates the fraction contains multiple components.

all distillates are pure.error: Distillates can still contain mixed components.
all distillates are pure.fix: Especially with close bp compounds, fractions overlap.
all distillates are pure.action: Re-distillation or fractional distillation improves purity.

colour indicates purity.error: Most pure organic liquids are colourless.
colour indicates purity.fix: Use boiling point or other tests to assess purity.
colour indicates purity.action: Colourless doesn't mean pure; coloured might still be pure.

yield equals purity.error: High yield doesn't mean high purity.
yield equals purity.fix: You might collect a lot of impure material.
yield equals purity.action: Trade-off: higher purity often means lower yield.

persistent.action: Purity = how much of one compound. Yield = how much total collected.

distillation_principle.title: Distillation Principle
distillation_principle.content: Distillation separates liquid mixtures based on boiling point differences. The more volatile component (lower bp) vaporises first, is condensed, and collected as distillate.
keyPoints: Lower bp = more volatile = distils first

simple_distillation_use.title: Simple Distillation
simple_distillation_use.content: Simple distillation works well when boiling points differ by >25Â°C or when separating a liquid from dissolved non-volatile solids. No fractionating column is used.

fractional_distillation_use.title: Fractional Distillation
fractional_distillation_use.content: Fractional distillation is needed when boiling points are within 25Â°C of each other. The fractionating column provides multiple separation cycles for better purity.

fractionating_column.title: Fractionating Column
fractionating_column.content: The fractionating column contains surfaces where vapour partially condenses and re-vaporises. Each cycle enriches the vapour in the lower-boiling component.

condenser_function.title: Condenser Function
condenser_function.content: The condenser cools vapour to liquid. Cold water flows through the outer jacket (counter-current to vapour) while vapour passes through the inner tube.

boiling_point_relationship.title: Boiling Point and Distillation Order
boiling_point_relationship.content: Components distil in order of their boiling points, with the lowest bp component first. Monitor the thermometer to know when different fractions are distilling.

collecting_fractions.title: Collecting Fractions
collecting_fractions.content: Change the receiving vessel when the temperature changes significantly. Each fraction contains compounds within a specific boiling point range.
keyPoints: Each fraction has a bp range

distillate_purity.title: Distillate Purity
distillate_purity.content: Purity is indicated by the boiling point range of the collected fraction. Narrow range = high purity. Broad range = mixture of components.
